text: Mark Dayton (born January 26, 1947) is an American politician. He was the 40th Governor of Minnesota from 2011 to 2019. He was the United States Senator from Minnesota 2001 to 2007. He is a member of the Democratic-Farmer-Labor Party. He ran for Governor in 1998, but lost the nomination to Skip Humphrey. In January 2017, Dayton was diagnosed with prostate cancer. ==References== Category:1947 births Category:Living people Category:United States senators from Minnesota Category:Governors of Minnesota Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:Politicians from Minneapolis
title: Mark Dayton
